title: Mindletic, Software Developer Intern
points: Developed a consumer platform that increased user well-being metrics by 26%
Integrated GraphQL to optimize data querying and create a more responsive interface
Designed and implemented user-friendly features, ensuring the platform is accessible and easy to navigate for all users
Utilized modern technologies such as React, Next.js, and Apollo Client to build a robust and scalable application

title: MIT Sloan School of Management, Researcher
points: Engaged in research of graphs in game theory to model the systemic cyber risk problem insurance companies face
Presented results from extensive Monte Carlo simulations orally at the Winter Simulation Conference 2024
Created risk assessment strategies based on results for company partners, including Liberty Mutual and Mastercard

title: Hudson River Trading, Women in Trading Technology Intern
points: Interned at Hudson River Trading, a quantitative trading firm accounting for 8% of all trading in the US in 2021
Created predictive models and a high-frequency trading strategy that generated profit in live trading and in simulation
Produced software tools to support developers in conducting signal research and creating trading strategies efficiently
Built a level book and a matching engine with optimal efficiency that updates with real-time data

title: Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory, Researcher
points: Created a social network called PawConnect using Graffiti API, meant to enable users to build their own social media
Built an image feed and interactive map to let users share cute animal photos, pet-friendly attractions, and more
Discovered limitations that prompted creators to update Graffiti with better support for reactive variables
